newsitem.title: ROMANIA: RADIO ROMANIA AFTERNOON HEADLINES AT 1 PM.
newsitem.headline: RADIO ROMANIA AFTERNOON HEADLINES AT 1 PM.

text.p: * The Romanian government started talks with leaders of the opposition Party of Social Democracy (PDSR) and National Unity Party (PUNR) on the government's medium-term reforms. The PDSR delegation is led by ex-president Ion Iliescu.
* The cabinet is expected to meet in the afternoon to discuss increasing the health budget.
* Ruling National Peasant Party (PNTCD) hailed the decision of some U.S. Senators who asked President Bill Clinton to invite Emil Constantinescu to visit the United States.
The PNTCD expressed concern about calls by union leaders for labour protests over pay and planned reforms, saying they contradicted previous declarations to support the reforms.

* Moldova wants to conclude the bilateral treaty with Romania as soon as possible, Moldovan President Petru Lucinski said. Lucinski said Russian President Boris Yeltsin reassured him of the withdrawal of the 14th Russian Army from Moldova.

* Bucharest's city hall cannot keep its vow to offer free urban transportation for pensioners, deputy mayor Anton Vatasescu said. He said pensioners would probably get a 50 percent discount. -- Bucharest Newsroom 40-1 3120264
